result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren J Koopman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of supervision.
Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Plea and Sentencing - December 4, 2014 - Anjanette M. Klein

Defendant Darren J Koopman in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint read, defendant advised of penalties.  Defendant entered plea of guilty.   Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty and renders sentence. Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon she/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she/he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored. State also requested to withdraw the 2nd enhancer (near park), so ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darren J Koopman in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment for disposition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Per State, no objection regarding request for adjournment. Forward to court for review.

Defendant Darren J Koopman in court, in custody.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. DeJunco informs the court he is not appearing for defendant, who may retain counsel. Court is informed there may be a probation hold on defendant. Defendant waives time limits. Court orders $2500 cash bail.  Status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
